text: today I'm making something really
delicious and it's actually super easy
you guys are going to love it it's a
tortilla pie with black beans cheddar
cheese all good stuff these are 10-inch
flour tortillas and they need to be nine
inches because I'm making this in a
springform pan that's nine inches so it
needs to fit directly inside of that you
can trim around the bottom of the pan to
get it to be the size you want this way
it'll fit really nicely right in the
side of your pan and then you can get
rid of this if you're super thrifty you
can I don't know bake these and eat them
as a snack all right then you can put
your springform pan back together to
start off with one onion got that cut up
I'm gonna mint it because I like my
onions minced if you don't mind little
bits of onion in there you could do it
at slightly larger like a dice a nice
sharp knife to go right through your
onion and make it very easy to slice and
dice also two cloves of garlic you can
mince those as well start by crushing
them a little bit to start off the
process and then just run your knife
over it and then one chili this is a I
can't tell I think it's a jalapeno
almost looks like a serrano and then you
can remove the seeds if you want less
heat but I'm a spice head so I'm leaving
them in now we can start some Tang so
you want to saute your aromatics to
build flavor heat about a tablespoon of
canola oil and then add your onion chili

three to five minutes I like to cook my

right here with my veggies half a
teaspoon of cumin and I'm gonna add just
a touch more oil to that
so that it really really fries rock
cumin mm-hmm not delicious fried cumin
kind of amazing gives like this
toasty depth of flavor that is really

well not too much pepper because you
already got a lot of spice from the

boom when we're gonna saute this and
simmer it down with some fear one can of

to your pan if you don't like beer you
don't want beer you can use chicken
stock or even water this needs to simmer
for about eight to ten minutes just so
that the beer cooks out and reduces down
so while you're doing that you can cut
up some scallions four scallions thinly
sliced this guy's doing the liquid has
almost evaporated so now I'm going to
add some corn this can be fresh corn or
frozen corn it's one package of frozen
is what I'm using but you can use about
two cups of fresh kernels if you have
them and then the scallions but save
some of the greens for garnish so set
those aside and stir that in if you're
using unfrozen corn fresh corn you
should add it just like a minute before
you turn it off so that the corn cooks
through the heat of the beans are gonna
cook this guy in just a little bit and
then you can build your pie here's the
pan nine-inch as I mentioned place one
of your trim tortillas in the bottom of
the pan so there are four tortillas and
you're gonna do this in four layers so
add about a quarter of your bean mixture
for each layer you don't have to be too
exact I don't think I'm not sure that it
matters but give a nice layer have your
oven preheating to 400 degrees if you're
gonna make this right away this is a
half a cup of cheese per layer and then
saved one whole cup for the top another
layer hey cheese if you're not making
this vegetarian and you have like some
chili left over you can layer some meat
chili in here last layer and then the
final cheese get this guy in the oven
what you want to do is bake it until
it's heated through and the cheese is
all melted that will take about 20-25
minutes the big reveal is happening now
you might want to let this cool off just
a little bit so that it cuts release the
sides as it cools the cheese might make
it stick just a little bit so you can
use the spatula to run around the edges
